name: df-itg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1
body: |- wceq(citg(s0, c0, c1), csu(s1, co(nat0, cfz, nat3), co(co(ci, cexp, cv(s1)), cmul, cfv(citg2, cmpt(s0, cr, csb(s2, cfv(cre, co(c1, cdiv, co(ci, cexp, cv(s1)))), cif(cv(s2), nat0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s2))))))))))
comment: Define the full Lebesgue integral, for complex-valued functions to ` RR ` . The syntax is designed to be suggestive of the standard notation for integrals. For example, our notation for the integral of ` x ^ 2 ` from ` 0 ` to ` 1 ` is ` S. ( 0 [,] 1 ) ( x ^ 2 ) _d x = ( 1 / 3 ) ` . The only real function of this definition is to break the integral up into nonnegative real parts and send it off to ~ df-itg2 for further processing. Note that this definition cannot handle integrals which evaluate to infinity, because addition and multiplication are not currently defined on extended reals. (You can use ~ df-itg2 directly for this use-case.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jun-2014.)
